recipe.name: Cheese and Bacon Muffin Tin Hash Browns
recipe.description: A great way to make hash browns for a crowd!
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp parsley (, finely chopped (for garnish - optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1/2 tbsp of olive oil in a pan over high heat. Add the bacon and sauté until crispy. Remove and drain on a paper towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1/2 tbsp of olive oil in a pan over high heat. Add the bacon and sauté until crispy. Remove and drain on a paper towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and grate the potatoes and place in a colander. Rinse under cold water for a few seconds (to remove starch which helps make them fluffy inside and also stops the potatoes from browning).
recipeInstructions.name: Peel and grate the potatoes and place in a colander. Rinse under cold water for a few seconds (to remove starch which helps make them fluffy inside and also stops the potatoes from browning).

recipeInstructions.text: Working a handful at a time, squeeze out the excess water and place into the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Working a handful at a time, squeeze out the excess water and place into the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add most of the bacon (reserve some to garnish), 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper and cheese. Mix well to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add most of the bacon (reserve some to garnish), 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper and cheese. Mix well to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray a 12 hole muffin tray with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray a 12 hole muffin tray with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Place 1/3 cup (packed) of the mixture into each hole. Pat down lightly with the back of a spoon.
recipeInstructions.name: Place 1/3 cup (packed) of the mixture into each hole. Pat down lightly with the back of a spoon.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 30 minutes until dark golden brown on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 30 minutes until dark golden brown on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Let stand for a few minutes before turning out from the muffin tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Let stand for a few minutes before turning out from the muffin tray.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with parsley and remaining bacon, and serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with parsley and remaining bacon, and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Delicious delicious delicious! Snack on them, have them for breakfast with an egg, or have them with dinner to sexy up meat and three veg! Great recipe Nagi x
Hi Nagi, have you tried adding eggs to add protein?

Thank you for the recipe Nagi, couldn't think what to make for tea (Aussie for evening meal). Will try them 2nite. Sound yummy - who wouldn't love all the ingredients together. I'm like you, love my spuds!!   Carol
